channel.title: [C4D] Lighting
channel.description:
Here's a tip. Use some damn lighting.
What is this you ask :confused:
One of the first steps to getting away from these shitty images.
It's the button that resembles a light (nowai).
Hold it down for more and better options! *applause*
Then find out how to turn shadows on! And explore the options of the different lights!
OMG SHADOWS FTW.

item.title: [C4D] Lighting
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

Lol, can you make your post a bit more clear? I can’t understand O.o
But yes, lighting is good, I do it too, but wondering if you do it another way.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Lighting
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

Im still a beginner at lighting but im coming along with it, it does really bring out the image and complete it if its done right

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Lighting
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

I do the same.

I also agree about this whole lighting thing. One of the most important parts of any scene, if not the most. There is a really good beginner in depth tutorial on it by 3DKiwi at C4D Cafe. But yeh, lighting…do it mufkrs

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Lighting
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

I guess it’s a style of writing, I got through phases I think. I don’t like typing huge paragraphs at all. And I guess I kinda put new points on each line.

I used to say & instead of and. So all my posts would be like:

So I went to the store the other day&I got me a new sweater.
Then I went home&smoked&drank&went to sleep.
win?

It’s not only here though, I do it pretty much on any social network, like Myspace, Facebook, and AIM.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Lighting
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

This topic is win. But STH, I’m curious. Why do you hit enter a few times before you post?

Read full topic
